JUDGES: Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Heiresh PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in LOC . He was represented before the ORG by Mr H. Frihagen , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Attorney , Attorney - ORG ) , as their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant stated that he arrived in GPE on DATE . On DATE he applied for asylum under the name ORG . During the asylum interview he informed that his surname was PERSON and that PERSON was the name of his home town . He further stated that upon registration of his asylum application he did not know what a surname was . He presented no passport or other recognised travel document which could confirm his identity .

According to the applicant he was of NORP origin because his mother was NORP . In GPE he had been registered as NORP because of his father ’s NORP origin . The applicant affirmed that he came from GPE . As a ground for applying for asylum , he referred to the generally unsatisfactory situation in GPE and to his health problems related to a kidney disease .
On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s asylum request for the following reasons :

“ ORG considers that in his home country [ the applicant ] has not been subject to reactions by the authorities , individuals or groups that can be characterised as persecution within the meaning of the LAW and LAW .
General conditions in GPE do not indicate that [ the applicant ] fulfils the requirements for asylum .
The upheavals resulting from the war , occupation and transition to NORP sovereignty have led to unrest in various parts of the country .
In spite of the general unrest , the ORG considers that the situation is not so geographically widespread that NORP asylum seekers are in general need of protection .

[ The applicant ] comes from a village in the disputed area in GPE . The ORG is aware that there is considerable tension in this area between NORP on the one hand and NORP and PERSON on the other . The ORG is closely following the security situation in the area . Although the security situation is difficult , the ORG does not consider that the current situation is of such a nature that all the inhabitants of the area are in considerable danger of losing their lives or being made to suffer inhuman treatment . ”
Represented by the same lawyer as before ORG , the applicant appealed to ORG . It rejected his appeal on DATE , stating inter alia :

“ Furthermore , [ the applicant ] may not be sent back to an area where , for reasons similar to those given in the definition of a refugee , he is in considerable danger of losing his life or of suffering inhuman treatment , cf . section CARDINAL ) , second sentence , of LAW . The provision must be interpreted in accordance with GPE ’s international commitments under LAW ... , cf . section CARDINAL of LAW . Under this provision the requirements as to the nature of the danger and the probability that it will occur are somewhat stricter than those under LAW .

In ORG of NORP outside GPE dated DATE and ORG of NORP Asylum - Seekers of DATE , cf . DATE , ORG advises against all return to ORG , and states that NORP asylum - seekers from these regions should be recognised as refugees . ORG recommends furthermore that protection should be afforded to asylum - seekers who are not recognised as refugees . ORG refers to the general violence , the large numbers of internal refugees , the inability and unwillingness of the authorities to provide protection , high unemployment , inadequate supplies of fuel , electricity and water , and the inadequacy of health care , education and other services .

ORG considers that the ORG recommendations are relevant and should be given weight since they provide important information about the situation in GPE and make a valuable contribution to decisions on which persons have a right to protection under LAW . However , the case can not be decided on the basis of the recommendations alone . ORG also must take other information into account and arrive at a decision in keeping with the provisions of LAW and other existing legislation .

[ The applicant ] has stated that he comes from GPE . ORG is aware that the situation in this area is characterised by violence and unrest , and that the security situation is unstable and difficult . GPE is in the disputed area , the area surrounding the border between GPE and the rest of GPE . Most of the inhabitants of the region are NORP , and the largest minority groups are PERSON , NORP and NORP . GPE is mainly under NORP political and military control , but the minority groups are also represented in government bodies .

The level of violence has at times been high over DATE , partly because of the presence of a number of militant groups . The violence in GPE has mainly taken the form of shooting attacks , road bombs , suicide bombs and car bombs , which are primarily directed at the security forces and the police , but local politicians and their families and the civilian population have also been attacked .

However , ORG considers that in spite of this , the current situation is not of such a nature that all the inhabitants of the region are in considerable danger of losing their lives or being made to suffer inhuman treatment . The latest reports from the region , including those compiled by ORG , ORG , ORG and ORG , indicate that the security situation is improving . The violence is currently more limited in scope and seems to be targeted more often at particular groups than is the case in other central and southern parts of GPE . The ORG ’s established practice also indicates that in GPE the general security situation alone does not justify protection of NORP . In this connection the ORG comments that since [ the applicant ] ’s father is a NORP and since [ the applicant ] is registered in GPE as a NORP , he must be considered to be a NORP .

Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , a work or residence permit may be granted on grounds of strong humanitarian considerations or when a foreign national has a particular connection with GPE . The provision is not intended to cover circumstances that are common to most appellants . Examples of factors that may be taken into account in an overall assessment are that return to the home country is inadvisable for [ the applicant ] or that the decision would involve immigration policy considerations .

As regards the available information concerning [ the applicant ] ’s state of health , the ORG comments that health - related circumstances do not as a rule constitute grounds for a stay in GPE . The claim that treatment in GPE is in general better than in [ the applicant ] ’s home country is not being given weight since it is noted that [ the applicant ] is able to receive necessary and adequate treatment in his home country . [ The applicant ] has himself stated that treatment for kidney stones is available in GPE .

If the claim based on [ the applicant ] ’s state of health is to be given weight in the overall assessment , this must in principle be documented in writing in the form of an up - to - date medical certificate issued in GPE . Normally less weight is given to certificates that are not in accordance with chapter CARDINAL of Circular IS-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , “ Certificates / medical certificates etc . for use in cases relating to foreign nationals ” , published by ORG . Importance is not normally attached to undocumented or insufficiently documented information concerning health . It is noted that ORG has not received any information concerning [ the applicant ] ’s state of health .

If a permit is to be granted on the basis of physical health problems alone , the problem must be sufficiently serious for [ the applicant ] ’s return to his home country to be considered unjustifiable . In practice , this means that the illness must be acute and life - threatening . In exceptional cases , a permit may be granted in the event of a serious chronic illness that would threaten the patient ’s life if left untreated .

ORG considers that [ the applicant ] ’s health problems are not serious enough to constitute the sole basis for a permit . Kidney stones can not be considered a serious chronic life - threatening illness . There are therefore no strong humanitarian considerations that would constitute grounds for granting a permit under section CARDINAL , second paragraph , of LAW .

According to the information provided by [ the applicant ] , he lived in GPE until DATE , while he has only lived in GPE for DATE . Furthermore , his family is in GPE . His connection with his home country is strong , and he has no particular connection with GPE . His stay in connection with his application for asylum can not be given weight .
ORG considers that [ the applicant ] does not have a sufficiently strong connection with GPE to justify the granting of a work or residence permit .

On the basis of an overall assessment , ORG considers that the conditions set out in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW have not been fulfilled . Thus , there are no grounds for granting a work permit under this provision . ”
On DATE ORG gave the applicant until DATE to contact the police regarding his departure from GPE .
On DATE the applicant filed a request to the ORG to stop his deportation to GPE .

On DATE the President of ORG decided in the interest of the proper conduct of the proceedings before the ORG to indicate to ORG , under LAW , that the applicant should not be expelled to GPE until further notice . On DATE ORG accordingly decided to suspend the enforcement of its decision .
On DATE the President decided to give notice of the application , inviting the parties to address the following CARDINAL questions :
“ CARDINAL . Has the applicant exhausted domestic remedies with regard to his submissions to the effect that his expulsion to GPE would be contrary to the Convention ?

CARDINAL . Bearing in mind , amongst other considerations , the position of the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees’ with regard to forcible return to LOC and their assessment of the general situation in that part of the country , including in GPE ( the applicant ’s former place of residence ) , would his expulsion to GPE be compatible with Articles QUANTITY or CARDINAL of the Convention ? ”

In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant provided certain documents , including medical statements according to which he had suffered from a kidney stone disease at a young age and had undergone an operation . Whilst CARDINAL kidney had a defect , the other functioned normally . He also suffered from chronic muscular- and bone infection , resulting in reduced functional ability and affecting him DATE . Arrangements had been made for him to receive physiotherapy .
ORG interpreted this new information as a request for reconsideration of its rejection of DATE and rejected the request on DATE , giving the following reasons :
“ There is no basis for altering the ORG ’s previous decision . The case is essentially in the same position as that previously determined and reference is made to the reasoning in that decision .

What is of central importance for an application for asylum is the alleged need for protection according to LAW and/or section CARDINAL of LAW . By its earlier decision ORG rejected the application for asylum . No new information has emerged suggesting that [ the applicant ] nonetheless has a need for protection . In the ORG ’s assessment , there were no such circumstances as mentioned in section CARDINAL ) of LAW .

If justified by strong humanitarian considerations and if the foreign national has particular links to GPE , a residence permit may be granted under section CARDINAL ) of LAW . Making a concrete assessment of the request for reconsideration and other information in the case , the ORG does not find that this condition has been fulfilled .

The request for reconsideration is in the main based on the [ the applicant ’s ] state of health . The ORG observes that a consideration of a claim to stay in GPE on grounds of a claimant ’s health condition must be based on the causes of the health problems , their level of seriousness , the need for treatment and the availability of treatment in the person ’s country of origin . It is not decisive whether the treatment offered in GPE is in general better than in the person ’s home country , or whether the quality of life is generally better in GPE . It is more a question of whether it is inadvisable to return to the home country . According to the ORG ’s practice , in cases of physical illnesses there ought , as a starting point , to be an acute and life - threatening suffering . Exceptionally , a permit to stay may be granted if the appellant suffers from a serious and chronic illness that by its nature may be life - threatening if it is not treated .

The ORG can not see that the submitted information concerning [ the applicant ] ’s state of health is of such a seriousness , has been caused by such factors , or that there is a future need for medical treatment , as to warrant a residence permit on this ground . ”

On DATE the applicant , with the assistance of a lawyer , applied to the County Governor of GPE and Akershus for a grant of free legal aid ( fri sakførsel ) under LAW ( CARDINAL ) of ORG , in order to have his case reviewed by the courts . He referred to LAW CARDINAL indication of CARDINAL DATE mentioned above and to its decision to give notice of the application to ORG . The applicant pointed out that he held no residence- or work permit , but his stay in GPE was lawful because the authorities had suspended the enforcement of his expulsion following the ORG ’s Rule CARDINAL indication . In this situation he had no right to pursue gainful employment or to receive social security benefits and therefore had no means of obtaining an income . The condition of indigence applying to grants of legal aid had therefore been fulfilled .

The applicant further emphasised that the case affected him particularly . He feared being killed or exposed to torture , inhuman or degrading treatment upon return to his home country . He stressed that it was only in a small proportion of cases that the ORG applied Rule DATE and gave notice of the application to the respondent ORG .

As a starting point the national remedies ought to be exhausted before lodging an application with the ORG . The applicant did not have the necessary financial means for obtaining judicial review . The case raised so many complex issues of fact and of law that the applicant could not be expected to represent himself . He did not master NORP . Without free legal aid it would not be possible for him to have his case reviewed by the national courts .

In this case , where the ORG had applied Rule CARDINAL and given notice of the application to the respondent ORG , it was obvious that the case had reasonable prospects of success . In cases involving allegations of violations of the LAW that were not manifestly ill - founded and were made by litigants who did not have any lawful means of receiving an income , legal aid should be granted liberally . In any event , in this case legal aid should be granted in view of the real and immediate risk the applicant was facing of treatment contrary to LAW upon return .

On DATE , the County Governor , making a global assessment on the basis of Circular G-CARDINAL/CARDINAL and observing that an exemption from the duty to pay court fees was to be dealt with under the same rules as free legal aid ( section CARDINAL of ORG ) refused the request on the ground that he did not consider the conditions in section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of Act to have been fulfilled :

" GPE does not find that there are special reasons to depart from the restrictive practice that applies in respect of a grant of legal aid before the courts in non - prioritized areas such as that of the present case . The [ applicant ] ’s fundamental legal guarantees must be deemed to have been safeguarded through the administrative proceedings in this case .

Furthermore , the County Governor has taken into account the argument that ORG has taken the measure to invite ORG to submit observations in the case and further that this is done in a very small proportion of the cases , but can not see that this is a sufficient reason for departing from the very strict practice applied in immigration cases not falling under LAW ( CARDINAL ) no . CARDINAL , cf . Circular G-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , paragraph CARDINAL . ”

The applicant appealed but on DATE ORG upheld the County Governor ’s decision . Albeit satisfied that the applicant fulfilled the financial conditions for free legal aid , it dismissed his appeal notably with reference to section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of ORG , giving inter alia the following reasons :

section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) no . CARDINAL of ORG , cf . ORG Circular G-CARDINAL/CARDINAL , section CARDINAL . In immigration cases that are not prioritised , free legal representation is granted only exceptionally , if there are entirely special reasons , for example where the case raises questions of particular interest that have not previously been examined by the courts .

ORG finds against the background of the documents presented that the case does not have sufficient common traits with the subject matters mentioned in LAW ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) . Nor do we find it shown that the case raises questions of principle of particular interest that have not been previously examined by the courts .

In practice it is considered that , as a main rule , the public authorities should not grant legal aid in cases concerning judicial review in respect of decisions by ORG . The reason for this is that the claimant already has had his or her case reviewed administratively by both ORG and by ORG . These instances possess special competence within immigration law . The present case has been examined by the immigration authorities CARDINAL times , without success . ... In this connection it is noted that the [ applicant ] has been assisted by a lawyer both in connection with his administrative appeal and his request for reconsideration . Therefore , his fundamental need for legal security must be considered to have been safeguarded through the administrative examination of the case .

In the assessment regard has also been had to [ the applicant ’s ] allegation that NORP authorities by their practice with regard to work - permits and free legal aid put an effective barrier against foreigners to have their cases reviewed by the courts . In this connection ORG point to that fact that ORG is a social support arrangement aimed at ensuring legal assistance to persons who do not themselves have the financial conditions for taking care of needs for legal assistance of great importance from an individual point of view and with a view to their personal welfare , cf . section CARDINAL of the Act . The principal aim of ORG is to provide assistance to those who do not have financial capacity to cover expenses for legal assistance . Even if the financial conditions for free legal aid are fulfilled free legal aid is not always granted in all types of cases . The LAW distinguishes between priority cases without means testing , priority case with means testing and non - prioritised cases . In the present case the [ applicant ] fulfils the financial criteria , but the case is by nature non - prioritised according to LAW . In such cases a restrictive practise is generally applied .

Regard is further had to the argument that ORG by a letter of CARDINAL DATE indicated to the NORP authorities not to deport the applicant . ORG does not consider that this indication has been based on a thorough examination of the validity of ORG decision . It is observed that it does not appear from the case documents on what ground the ORG has based its decision .

By letter of CARDINAL DATE the ORG stated that the NORP office of ORG ) had informed NORP immigration authorities that the applicant had on DATE applied , via ORG , for voluntary return to his country of origin .
On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer informed the ORG that the application to ORG would be withdrawn DATE .

Under LAW ( tvisteloven ) , a decision by ORG could form the subject of an appeal to the competent city court or district court ( tingrett ) ( ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , from there to ORG ( lagmannsrett ) ( ORG CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) and ultimately to ORG ( Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) . The domestic courts had full jurisdiction to review the lawfulness of the ORG ’s decision and were empowered to quash the decision should they find that it was unlawful .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW DATE , the provisions of the LAW were to be applied in accordance with GPE ’s international legal obligations intended to strengthen the legal position of a foreign national . In the event of conflict between the national legal provision and GPE ’s obligations under the Convention , the latter was to take precedence ( sections QUANTITY and CARDINAL of LAW DATE ) .

Under Chapters DATE of the Code , a person whose expulsion had been ordered by the immigration authorities could apply to the courts for an interlocutory injunction to stay the implementation of the expulsion order .
Further conditions regarding judicial review of ORG decision were set out inter alia in the following provisions and guidelines .

At the material time , the fee for filing a lawsuit before ORG or ORG ( tingrett ) was MONEY ( “ ORG ” ) , corresponding to MONEY ( “ NORP ” ) , if the hearing lasted for DATE and ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( FAC ) if the hearing lasted for DATE .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW DATE , fees should be paid in advance . In the event that a sufficient amount had not been paid when a request for a judicial order had been made , the court was to fix a brief time - limit for payment . In the event that payment is not effected within the time - limit fixed , the court shall dismiss the case , unless the provisions in section CARDINAL apply . The latter provided :

“ If a party has applied for free legal aid or for exemption from the payment of court fees under LAW DATE , a respite should be granted until the application has been decided . In this event no security can be required for the payment of the fee .

If a party who has requested a procedural step [ rettergangsskritt ] has obtained respite in accordance with the foregoing , the court shall grant the measure . In other cases the court may grant a measure if the party who has requested it is unable to pay immediately and it would entail a damage or significant inconvenience for that party if the measure is not taken . If the measure requires payments , an advance payment may be made by the public authorities .

If a measure has been taken with a respite , the court shall fix a time - limit for payment . Until payment has been made or the time - limit has expired , the court shall only take such measures as it deems necessary . If payment is not made within the time - limit , the court gives a ruling in absentia according to ORG DATE and CARDINAL of LAW . ”

An exception from the condition to pay court fees could be granted as part of a grant to free legal representation according to the same rules as those that applied to the latter ( section CARDINAL of ORG ) . A person who was not entitled to free legal representation could be granted an exemption from the duty to pay court fees provided that the financial conditions in section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) or ( CARDINAL ) had been fulfilled ( see below ) .

According to LAW be represented by counsel ( LAW ) , but was not obliged to be so represented , save if the party was unable to present the case in a comprehensible manner and the court has ordered the party to appear with counsel ( LAW ) .
Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) to ( CARDINAL ) of ORG DATE included the following provisions of relevance to the present case :
“ Free legal representation shall be granted without means testing in ... the following instances :
CARDINAL . to a foreign national in such instances as mentioned in LAW , second sentence , and ( CARDINAL ) of LAW [ DATE ] ....

In such cases as mentioned in CARDINAL ) nos . CARDINAL - CARDINAL [ not applicable in the instant case ] , an application for free legal representation may be granted to a person whose income and assets do not exceed certain levels set by ORG .

In other cases , free legal representation may be granted exceptionally , provided that the financial conditions pursuant to the second sub - section are fulfilled and that the case affects the claimant especially from an objective point of view . In the assessment , weight should be attached to whether the case has similarities with the litigation areas mentioned in the first and second sub - sections .

In such cases as mentioned in the second and third sub - sections , free legal representation may be granted even if the claimant does not fulfil the financial conditions prescribed in the second sub - section , provided that the expenses for legal assistance will be substantial compared to the claimant ’s financial situation .
Free legal representation shall not be granted pursuant to the second through fourth sub - sections where it would be unreasonable that such assistance be paid out of public funds . ”
In ORG G-CARDINAL/CARDINAL ORG and ORG stated at paragraph CARDINAL :

“ In immigration cases not covered by LAW ( CARDINAL ) nr CARDINAL , the practice should be very restrictive . The general legal security of the foreigner is considered to be sufficiently secured through the administrative processing of the case . Legal aid to take the case before court should only be granted in exceptional cases , i.e. if there are very specific reasons , for instance if the case presents questions of a particular principal interest that has not previously been tried by the courts . ”
Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of ORG Act DATE ( domstolloven ) provided :

“ In the event that a person , who does not know NORP , is to take part in the proceedings , an interpreter appointed and approved by the court shall be used . Recordings are to be made in NORP . If required by the importance of the case , the court may decide that recording shall take place in a foreign language , either in the court records or in separate annexes , to be submitted for approval . ”
The Government referred in particular to the following provisions of LAW :
Section CARDINAL - CARDINAL Conduct of the proceedings . Plan for further proceedings
“ ( CARDINAL ) The court shall actively and systematically conduct the preparation of the case to ensure that it is heard in a swift , cost effective and sound manner . ”
Section CARDINAL - CARDINAL The court ’s position with regard to
the procedural steps taken by the parties
“ ( CARDINAL ) ....

( CARDINAL ) The parties have the primary responsibility for presenting evidence . The court can take care of the presentation of evidence if the parties do not object . The court is not bound by the parties’ arguments with regard to questions of evidence . ”
Section CARDINAL - CARDINAL The court ’s responsibility to apply the law

“ The court shall on its own motion apply current law within the scope of LAW ) . In accordance with LAW CARDINAL - CARDINAL , the court shall ensure that there is a satisfactory basis upon which to apply the law . If the application of law can not otherwise be clarified in a fully satisfactory manner , the court may decide that evidence of the law shall be presented , or it may allow the parties to present such evidence . The court shall determine the scope of the presentation of evidence and the manner in which it shall be carried out . Statements on the law occasioned by the case may only be submitted as evidence with the consent of all parties . ”
Section CARDINAL - CARDINAL The court ’s duty to give guidance

“ ( CARDINAL ) The court shall give the parties such guidance on procedural rules and routines and other formalities as is necessary to enable them to safeguard their interests in the case . The court shall seek to prevent errors and shall give such guidance as is necessary to enable errors to be rectified . ...

( CARDINAL ) The court shall , in accordance with subsections ( CARDINAL ) to ( CARDINAL ) , give guidance that contributes to a correct ruling in the case based on the facts and the applicable rules .
( CARDINAL ) The court shall endeavour to clarify disputed issues and ensure that the parties’ statements of claim and their positions regarding factual and legal issues be clarified .
( CARDINAL ) The court may encourage a party to take a position on factual and legal issues that appear to be important to the case .
( CARDINAL ) The court may encourage a party to offer evidence .
( CARDINAL ) The court shall during the proceedings show particular consideration for the need for guidance of parties not represented by counsel .

( CARDINAL ) The court shall provide its guidance in a manner that is not liable to impair confidence in its impartiality . The court shall not advise the parties on the position they should take on disputed issues in the case or on procedural steps they should take . ”
Section CARDINAL - CARDINAL Duty of the court to take an active part
in the conduct of the proceedings
“ ( CARDINAL ) The court shall prepare a plan for dealing with the case and follow it up in order to bring the case to a conclusion in an efficient and sound manner .
( CARDINAL ) ....
( CARDINAL ) In each case , a preparatory judge shall be responsible for the conduct of the proceedings .

According to a report of DATE by the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( UNHCR Return Advisory and ORG of NORP Outside GPE ) , no forcible return of NORP from NORP or Central GPE should take place until there was a substantial improvement in the security and human rights situation in the country .

In a follow - up report of DATE ( ORG ’s ORG of ORG ) , the ORG encouraged the adoption of a prima facie approach for NORP asylum - seekers from LOC and stated that they should be considered as refugees based on the DATE Convention relating to LAW in signatory countries . In its more recent LAW of DATE , the ORG observed that in view of the serious human rights violations and ongoing security incidents which were continuing in the country , most predominantly in the CARDINAL LOC of GPE , NORP , GPE , GPE and ORG , the ORG continued to consider all NORP asylum seekers from these CARDINAL LOC to be in need of international protection and stated that , in signatory countries , they should be considered as refugees based on the DATE Convention criteria ( see paragraph CARDINAL of the Guidelines ) . The Guidelines observed inter alia :

“ CARDINAL . In the context of LOC of GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and PERSON where , even though the security situation has improved in parts , there is still a prevalence of instability , violence and human rights violations by various actors , and the overall situation is such that there is a likelihood of serious harm . Armed groups remain lethal , and suicide attacks and car bombs directed against the ORG - I / ISF [ ORG in GPE / Iraqi Security Forces ] , Awakening Movements and civilians , in addition to targeted assassinations and kidnappings , continue to occur on a regular basis , claiming the lives of civilians and causing new displacement . These methods of violence are usually targeted at chosen areas where civilians of specific religious or ethnic groups gather , including places of worship , market places , bus stations , and neighbourhoods . Violence appears often to be politically motivated and linked to ongoing struggles over territory and power among various actors . As clarified above , even where an individual may not have personally experienced threats or risks of harm , events surrounding his or her areas of residence or relating to others , may nonetheless give rise to a well - founded fear . There is also more specific targeting of individuals by extremist elements of CARDINAL religious or political group against specific individuals of another , through kidnappings and execution - style killings . ”
As regards GPE , the LAW included the following observations ( footnotes omitted ) :

“ CARDINAL . Most violence in the GPE is linked to the yet unresolved administrative status of GPE and related power struggles between the various NORP , NORP and NORP actors . Security conditions in GPE Governorate , and in particular in GPE , tend to worsen during political events related to the status of GPE as armed groups aim at influencing political decisions . For example , during intense negotiations over a provincial elections law in DATE , a suicide attack on demonstrating NORP resulted in an outbreak of inter - communal violence , in which CARDINAL people were killed and CARDINAL injured . Conversely , tensions and sporadic violence can complicate future status negotiations . With the postponing of provincial elections in GPE , the security situation has somewhat stabilized . However , simmering inter - communal tensions are prone to erupt into new violence ahead of decisions to be taken in relation to GPE ’s unresolved status . Some observers note that tensions among ethnic groups over the unresolved status of GPE could turn into another civil war . NORP groups such as ORG [ ORG in GPE ] also aim at stirring inter - communal violence by attacking proponents of ethnic / religious groups . Furthermore , it has been reported that community groups in GPE are arming themselves in preparation for future clashes .

CARDINAL . GPE ’s NORP and NORP communities complain of harassment , intimidation , arbitrary arrests and demographic manipulation at the hands of the NORP , who dominate the Governorate ’s political and security institutions . NORP law enforcement personnel and political leaders are in turn popular targets for assassination . ORG and ORG offices are also a regular target of attacks . Recently , CARDINAL members of ORG have been killed in their homes in GPE . The brother of a high - ranking member of the same party was also killed . Religious and ethnic minorities often find themselves caught up in the middle of struggles for power and territory .

CARDINAL . In GPE Governorate , there are regular roadside bombings , shootings , and occasional car bombs and suicide attacks . On DATE , a suicide bomber killed CARDINAL people and wounded CARDINAL when he detonated his explosive vest in a restaurant packed with government officials , women and children during lunch near GPE . There are also targeted kidnappings and assassinations , including of security officials , tribal leaders / SoI [ Sons of GPE ] , government officials and employees , ( mostly NORP ) party officials , members of minority groups [ referring notably to CARDINAL incidents of attacks against NORP ] , journalists and other professionals . Dead bodies continue to be found occasionally in GPE Governorate . ”
In DATE the ORG issued a Note on FAC of the DATE ORG of ORG . It contained the following information on security developments ( footnotes omitted ) :

“ Under the Status - of - Forces Agreement ( ORG ) of DATE , the NORP authorities have taken over full responsibility for the security of the country . The former ORG ( former ORG ) have withdrawn from NORP cities , towns and villages and operate from their military bases at the request of ORG . Currently , the GPE is drawing down all combat forces and is expected to complete this process by DATE . ORG ( ISF ) have almost reached their intended end strength of CARDINAL members . Since DATE ORG has been fully responsible for managing and integrating the largely Sunni Awakening Councils or Sons of Iraq ( NORP ) groups into the ORG and NORP government employment . This process is still ongoing and by DATE , of the CARDINAL NORP , CARDINAL had transitioned into the ORG and CARDINAL into other government employment .

ORG ) , a project which maintains data on civilian deaths , reported that in DATE the DATE civilian death toll was CARDINAL . Reports for DATE indicate that CARDINAL NORP were killed and CARDINAL others were injured during DATE . An upsurge in violence was noted since DATE elections and casualty statistics for DATE and DATE reflect an increase in the numbers of NORP killed and wounded in violence . Reports show that in DATE and DATE , insurgents carried out several mass - casualty attacks , including on high - profile , highly guarded targets such as NORP government institutions , prominent hotels and foreign embassies . The assaults resulted in CARDINAL of civilians killed or injured in the attacks . ORG in GPE claimed responsibility for the attacks against embassies in GPE and residential targets in mainly Shi’a districts of the capital in DATE . The reported incidents mostly took place in the central governorates of GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and PERSON as well as in GPE , which has seen an increase in violence since DATE . The relatively stable security situation in the NORP governorates is reportedly occasionally disrupted by mass - casualty attacks and low level violence mainly in areas close to GPE . GPE remains relatively stable , though there have been reported assaults on journalists and political opponents .

Among other security related developments worth noting is the start of the implementation of an interim joint security plan for GPE and other internally disputed areas by the USF - I. The plan is based on joint action and coordination by ORG and Police as well as ORG ( ORG . Thus far , the joint security plan has resulted in the establishment of a network of checkpoints and joint patrols around major cities , and the training of security personnel . Addressing the overall issue of the status of the “ disputed areas ” is among the challenges that await the new ORG . ORG matters to be resolved in this area include administrative boundaries , the control of oil resources , minority rights and other matters .

Since DATE , the ORG , with the help of the USF - I , have arrested or killed a large number of senior insurgent leaders , in particular members of ORG in GPE . Ongoing attacks illustrate that the groups are still intent on , and capable of , attacks .

Reports indicate that the targeting of Government of GPE officials , members of the NORP security forces , ORG members and prominent citizens continue unabated . Among the frequently targeted are NORP civilians and pilgrims as well as religious sites in different areas , religious and ethnic minority groups mainly in GPE and GPE Governorates ( GPE , NORP , GPE and Kaka’i ) , and the NORP minority , mainly in ORG , which includes CARDINAL NORP displaced from GPE in DATE . Compared to DATE , there has been a significant increase in the use of magnetic and adhesive bombs attached to vehicles as a weapon to assassinate particular individuals . Profiles targeted include , in particular , government officials and employees , party officials , members of ORG ( NORP ) , members of the ORG ( including off - duty members ) , religious and ethnic minorities [ referring to several incidents of attacks against NORP and a suicide truck bomber in , a Shi’ite NORP town QUANTITY south of GPE destroying homes and damaging another CARDINAL homes , affecting CARDINAL people ] , NORP and Shi’ite clerics , journalists , academics , doctors , judges and lawyers , human rights activists and NORP working for NGOs or the USF - I and foreign companies , alcohol vendors ( which are commonly NORP or PERSON ) , women and NORP individuals .
III . Conclusion

The situation in GPE is still evolving . ORG will continue to monitor developments in the country and will update the DATE ORG once it judges that the situation is sufficiently changed . In the interim , ORG advises those involved in the adjudication of international protection claims lodged by asylum - seekers from GPE and those responsible for establishing government policy in relation to this population continue to rely on the DATE ORG . Accordingly , the current ORG position on returns to GPE also remains unchanged . ”

ORG ) , an independent human rights research body set up to provide the NORP immigration authorities with relevant information , has in a report of DATE stated the following about the security situation in GPE city , and the situation for the NORP population there ( footnotes and references omitted ) :
“ CARDINAL . GPE
CARDINAL SECURITY SITUATION
It is generally recognized that the level of violence in GPE is by far lower than that in GPE and GPE .

The majority of the security incidents in the city appear to be attacks against police and military . Most frequent are attacks against road patrols , and against checkpoints and personnel . These attacks both take place on the roads between GPE and surrounding areas and inside the city . Occasional civilian casualties result from such attacks ... .
There are also occasional indiscriminate attacks aimed directly at civilians , such as suicide attacks at crowded places inside the city .

Additional types of targets have been recorded by ORG since DATE . These targets are very diverse . There have been attacks on local NORP political leaders and their families , on engineers and building contractors , oil business executives , private security guards , gas station workers , churches , NORP mosques , polling stations , and at a NORP political party office . In DATE an NORP journalist was killed .

The intensity of attacks against all target groups seems to have remained quite stable over DATE . DATE , DATE reported incidents were recorded ... . During DATE , a total of CARDINAL individuals were reported killed in violent incidents ( PERSON DATE ) .

In DATE , it was reported that violence had gone up since DATE , and that security remained highly unstable ... . According to the GPE military commander in GPE , by DATE violence had dropped by CARDINAL as compared to DATE ... . Figures indicate that since DATE , violence remains stable through DATE ... .

We do not have figures for DATE , nor do we know for how long period of time ‘ summer’ refers to . What the sources indicate , however , is that violence went up by DATE , then down again by DATE , and that it seems to have stabilized somewhat afterwards . With the reservation that we do n’t have exact figures to substantiate this trend , we do see , however , that the occurrence of violence is unstable through a fairly short period of time .
The factors accounting for the security problems continue to be present for the foreseeable future . Accordingly , an unstable level of violence may be expected to continue .
CARDINAL THE SITUATION FOR NORP IN GPE

It is commonly assumed that NORP currently make up a majority of the population in GPE city . However , no exact figures are available ... . A planned census has so far not been held . The city is run by a city council at which the main ethnic groups are proportionally represented . Accordingly , the NORP parties are in a majority . The city is said to be effectively run by the ORG [ ORG of GPE ] ... , which also governs the neighbouring governorate of GPE , The PERSON [ ORG ] is reportedly directly financing the teaching of the NORP language in GPE ’s schools ... .

The security in the city is handled by the ORG [ ORG ] , ORG , the NORP dominated police and NORP intelligence ( NORP ) together . NORP armed forces are posted inside the city . ORG deploys CARDINAL mainly NORP battalions there , which are supported by NORP Peshmerga forces not integrated in the ORG . The NORP have reportedly become the main component of the GPE police . The ORG runs a separate NORP branch in GPE ( NORP GPE ) which reports directly to ORG . ORG reportedly employs possibly CARDINAL personnel working undercover ... .

There are strong indications that the NORP plays a crucial role in providing the police and the ORG with vital intelligence about the plans and activities of armed groups operating in and around the city ... .
The NORP population is protected by forces and agencies run or dominated by the regional NORP political leadership , and who are partly or wholly loyal to it .

Taking these factors into consideration the NORP , as members of the majority population in the city , could be regarded as finding themselves in a favourable position compared to members of other ethnic groups .
A ORG by PERSON on the Security Situation in GPE and GPE ( Temanotat IRAK : Sikkerhetssituasjonen i GPE by og områdene rundt ) , dated DATE , summarised the situation as follows :

“ During DATE , the security situation in GPE has shown a decreasing level of activity on the part of armed groups , in spite of a persistent high level of political tension connected to the disputed political status of the city . Still , both GPE city and GPE province continue to be plagued by persistent political violence . There are no clear signs of open conflict between the NORP , NORP and NORP population groups , but widespread mutual mistrust seems to prevail along with a possibly increasing physical segregation between them . In this environment , militants continue to carry out attacks .
The armed groups operating in GPE , GPE and PERSON are all NORP . They appear as periodically connected to each other logistically , and to be coalescing over time . ”

In LAW it was observed inter alia that the conflict related violence in GPE had continuously decreased since DATE and had in DATE reached its lowest level since DATE . Nonetheless , politically motivated violence still occurred on a DATE basis . There were otherwise no new patterns of acts of violence . It was still the situation that such acts were primarily targeting authorities , the army and the political milieu . However , the casualties among the civilian population were considerably higher than those of the target groups .

The level of political violence appeared relatively low in view of the continuous political tensions related to the unclear political status of the city . At the same time , the political violence was directly linked to unresolved political questions . Both NORP regional authorities and the national central authorities claimed a right to governance in the city .

There was little information available which systematically presented the situation in the province for each of the CARDINAL ethnic groups – NORP , NORP and PERSON . According to the newspaper DATE ’s PERSON of DATE , the local police was composed of PERCENT NORP , PERCENT NORP and PERCENT Turkmens . In the NORP areas of the city there were both NORP and NORP officers . In the GPE district west of GPE , the officers were NORP .
Even though the different groupings were reasonably well represented within public administration and education , distrust between them had frequently been reported since DATE .
ORG ( ORG Country of ORG of CARDINAL DATE provided the following information ( footnotes omitted ) :
“ GPE

CARDINAL The ORG [ ORG ] Report DATE , dated DATE , covering events since DATE noted that : ‘ GPE has been generally stable since the previous reporting period . On DATE [ DATE ] , shots were fired at a USF - I / United Nations convoy travelling in GPE , resulting in CARDINAL ORG - I soldier being wounded . No UNAMI staff members were injured and the convoy immediately returned to Forward Operating Base Warrior.’

However the subsequent UNSC Report DATE , published CARDINAL DATE , observed that : ‘ [ CARDINAL withdrawal of ORG in GPE is likely to have a short- to medium - term effect on the security situation’ .

CARDINAL ORG on ORG conducted DATE , published DATE citing a reliable source in GPE stated : ‘ ... that GPE , with its unique status , is a completely different matter . The situation is fragile and ORG ( ISF ) and GPE forces have a strong presence in the area . AQIs [ ORG in GPE ] and insurgent groups’ presence contribute to making the situation particularly volatile , and there are reports that ORG is using children as suicide bombers or combatants in GPE
See also the section heading on LOC which highlighted that in DATE NORP Peshmerga troops entered GPE governorate in violation of agreed security procedures in place between NORP and NORP forces . ”
The third report of the ORG Secretary - General to the UNSC , pursuant to paragraph CARDINAL of resolution DATE ( DATE ) , included inter alia the following observations :
“ II . Summary of key political developments pertaining to GPE
A. Political developments

CARDINAL . In GPE , NORP parties holding the CARDINAL most senior political posts , Governor and Chairman of ORG , agreed to give up the latter , as a gesture of goodwill in order to move the political process forward and to accommodate a long - standing demand by NORP and NORP components . PERSON ( NORP ) was elected to the post of Chairman , PERSON ( NORP ) was appointed as the new Governor and PERSON ( NORP ) remained Deputy Governor .

CARDINAL . On DATE , NORP Peshmerga troops that had been deployed around the city of GPE since DATE withdrew and returned to the GPE region . The incident served as a reminder of the challenges that remain as ORG in GPE draw down and the combined security mechanism comes to an end . The combined security mechanism was established to encourage NORP security forces and NORP Peshmerga troops to coordinate their operations , set up joint patrols and checkpoints and exchange information under the auspices of ORG . ORG GPE and ORG have yet to agree on the future of the combined security mechanism or any successor arrangements that could be put into place after the departure of ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG in GPE have continued their planned withdrawal from the country with the intention of completing their departure by DATE , as envisaged under the status - of - forces agreement signed between ORG and GPE . Discussions have been ongoing regarding the possibility of some GPE forces remaining beyond DATE to provide training and support . The Prime Minister has stated that the issue would be decided on a consensus basis through dialogue among the political blocs , as formal agreement would require approval by ORG .
III . Activities of ORG
A. Political activities

CARDINAL . The standing consultative mechanism met several times during the reporting period . This initiative , which was launched in DATE under the auspices of ORG , brings together representatives of key political blocs to discuss outstanding issues related to disputed internal territories , including GPE . The participants include representatives of the CARDINAL main political blocs : Deputy Prime Minister PERSON ( ORG ) , Member of ORG PERSON ( ORG ) and ORG Minister PERSON ( Iraqiya ) . The participants agreed to focus on the following issues : ( a ) GPE , including powersharing issues and conducting provincial council elections ; ( b ) GPE , the current political stalemate , power - sharing and security issues ; ( c ) the future of the combined security mechanism ; and ( d ) the census . On DATE , participants agreed that subsequent meetings would be expanded to include local stakeholders from the GPE and GPE governorates . On DATE , a meeting was held that brought together for the first time all members of ORG from GPE in order to discuss issues related to power - sharing and the prospects of holding provincial council elections in GPE .
E. Human rights activities

CARDINAL . The reporting period witnessed a significant rise in assassinations of political leaders , government officials and security personnel . ... Assassination attempts were carried out against a NORP Member of ORG from GPE ... on DATE May ....

CARDINAL . Honour crimes committed against women are a continuing source of concern . UNAMI recorded the deaths in suspicious circumstances of CARDINAL women DATE in GPE . Police informed UNAMI that CARDINAL of the deaths were listed as suicides and CARDINAL as murders carried out by unknown persons , while the causes of death of the other QUANTITY women were unconfirmed but regarded as suspicious . ...

CARDINAL . There continue to be sporadic reports of children experiencing acts of indiscriminate violence and abductions . ... On DATE , in GPE , criminal gangs abducted a DATE girl who was later released after a ransom was paid . On DATE , a CARDINAL-year - old boy was abducted in GPE ; his fate remains unknown .
CARDINAL . During the reporting period , a number of public demonstrations were held , most of them peaceful . ...
PERSON , operational and logistical issues

CARDINAL . During the reporting period , ORG continued to operate in a challenging security environment . On DATE , a car bomb targeted the NORP police headquarters in GPE , killing CARDINAL policemen . In another incident on DATE , a complex attack on ORG left CARDINAL people dead and CARDINAL injured , including NORP police and civil defence members . This particular attack is believed to have been in response to the recent successful efforts by NORP security forces to locate weapons caches and key personnel wanted for terrorist attacks . ...

DATE . During the reporting period , ORG has been working on the transition of security support from ORG to the NORP security forces . On DATE , ORG requested that ORG of ORG , in coordination with ORG and ORG , support UNAMI protection requirements .

CARDINAL . During the reporting period , ORG also took steps to put in place the necessary logistical arrangements to substitute the support of ORG . ORG is also continuing preparations to ensure that it is able to sustain its presence in GPE and GPE .

CARDINAL . With support from ORG standing police capacity , a start - up team of CARDINAL UNAMI police liaison personnel have been deployed to GPE , GPE and GPE to engage and coordinate ORG operations with ORG and NORP police .
IV . Observations

CARDINAL . Although the status of GPE and other disputed internal territories remain divisive issues , I am encouraged by recent efforts by key NORP stakeholders to find common ground . Through the standing consultative mechanism under ORG auspices , political leaders , members of parliament and local representatives of GPE have engaged in a dialogue on critical issues that will affect the future of GPE and other disputed areas , including future security arrangements . I encourage ORG and ORG to continue to use this important forum to find mutually acceptable solutions that ultimately serve the interests of national reconciliation and long - term stability . ORG stands ready to assist in this process upon the request of the Government . ”
